title: Stored XSS in /admin/product and /admin/collections

profile.name: Shopify
profile.about: Shopify is a multi-channel commerce platform that helps people sell online, in-store, and everywhere in between.

vulnerability_information: ### Hello Security Team, I was going through previous reports of XSS and I have found this, https://hackerone.com/reports/978125 As stated by team on this page even on https://hackerone.com/shopify?type=team under Known issues that we can now report XSS under Rich Text Editor on Product description and Collection description. I have found XSS on this endpoints /admin/product and /admin/collections {F1252456} ### Steps to Reproduce: #### /admin/product Step1: Go to https://your-store.myshopify.com/admin/products?selectedView=all Step2: Click on Add product Step3: Add anything in Title Step4: Right side corner in description click on Show HTML Step5: Add below Payloads and Click on Save #### Payload: ">\] ">\] XSS will get triggered. {F1252457} #### /admin/collections Step1: Go to https://your-store.myshopify.com/admin/collections Step2: Click on Create collection Step3: Add anything in Title Step4: Right side corner in description click on Show HTML Step5: Add below Payloads and Click on Save #### Payload: ">\] ">\] XSS will get triggered. {F1252455} I have attached POC Video, Please take a look. {F1252458} #### Thank You Ashish Dhone ## Impact A malicious user can steal cookies and use them to gain further access even an attacker can use XSS to send requests that appear to be from the victim to the web server.

activities.message:
Hi @ashketchum,

Thanks for the report. You reported this issue on a weekend. Our team works from Monday to Friday, 9am-5pm. You should hear back from us soon regarding your report.

Hi @jack_mccracken ,

Thanks for your reply will make sure from next onwards :)

Hi @ashketchum,

Thanks for your report. We have confirmed your findings and our engineering team is working on a fix.

Hello Team,
any updates on this?

Hi @ashketchum,
Thanks again for your report! 
We're awarding a $5,300 bounty for this issue. Please find below our rationale generated using our [CVSS calculator](https://shopify.github.io/appsec/cvss_calculator/). We have set Privileges Required to None in this case, as the most likely attack scenario is a merchant pasting a malicious product description. This requires User Interaction, and results in a Low Confidentiality and Integrity impact, as this attack would compromise a single account at a time.

# Base Score CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:N 5.4
# Environment: Core

### Attack Complexity: L
* Specific conditions or measurable effort to exploit?: No

### Privileges Required: N
* Requires privileged account (not self-registered)?: No

### User Interaction: R
* Requires victim to perform some action during exploit?: Yes

### Scope: U
* Can the attacker impact a separate service?: No

### Confidentiality: L
* How much data could be accessed?: Most or All
* How much of Shopify is impacted?: Some

### Integrity: L
* How much data could be changed?: Most or All
* How much of Shopify is impacted?: Some

### Availability: N
* Level of disruption to network service?: None
Hacking on Shopify is always awesome, this was my 4th XSS... Thanks team for the bounty :)

i am owner #978125 and i am very surprised that yours got 5x from me.
congrats!

Hey @jaka_tingkir,

We add hackers who submit duplicate reports for transparency. Continuing to comment on reports that are not yours will disqualify you from this privilege in the future. 

> i am owner #978125 and i am very surprised that yours got 5x from me.

Your report was submitted before we started paying our bounties based on CVSS scores. We used to pay using a defined bounty table on our policy page, you can still view the table through this link https://hackerone.com/shopify/policy_versions?type=team&change=3642125

Hi @ashketchum,
Thanks again for your report! Our engineering team has deployed a fix to this issue and should no longer be reproducible.

Hi Team,
Can we disclose this report?

Hi Team,
Can we disclose this?

Hi @ashketchum,

Apologies for missing your previous message! We had to revert the change we had in place to fix the vulnerability you have reported. However, a second fix is nearing completion. As a result, we can disclose this report once the second fix is deployed. I will update you when that is.

Hello Team,

Hope you are doing well.

Does this issue has been resolved completely?

Thank You

Hi @ashketchum,

My apologies for not following up with you earlier. You are correct, the fix we had made has now been deployed. Any future XSS vulnerabilities you find will be reviewed separately from this report. Looking forward to what bugs you can find!

summaries.content: @ashketchum noticed that we changed our program policy to accept rich text editor-based XSS vulnerabilities and immediately got to testing. What they found was that an attacker could achieve stored XSS by putting a payload directly into the HTML editor and saving the contents, storing malicious code to be executed on subsequent page loads.
